programme.title: Manislam
programme.desc: Documentary examining the burdens of manhood within Islamic cultures, delving into the topics including democracy, equality, violence, oppression and male sexuality.

programme.title: Longmire
programme.desc: New series. The discovery of a body in the river sends waves through the team. Although the evidence points to suicide, Walt suspects that the dangerous Jacob Nighthorse may be involved, but his crusade to gather proof spins out of control. Meanwhile, the team struggles with the consequences of Branch's confrontation with Barlow.

programme.title: The UK Gold
programme.desc: Documentary about London vicar Father William Taylor as he campaigns and speak out against tax dodgers, and investigates the financial secrecy behind tax havens. Narrated by Dominic West.

programme.title: Shortland Street
programme.desc: Long-running hospital drama set in a New Zealand accident and emergency ward, following the private and professional lives of the staff who work there.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: When a student is found dead, it seems and open and shut case but Jimmi is not so sure. Meanwhile, Zara has a confrontation with Sid, but this time he fights back.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Royal Marine captain Jon's life changed for ever when he stepped onto a land mine in Afghanistan and lost three limbs. After viewing many uninspiring specialist homes and considering awkward conversions, he and partner Becky realised their best option was to build a property themselves. The design is cutting-edge, with sleek glass walls, open-plan spaces and a dramatic wing-like roof, and the couple want there to be no noticeable adaptations. However, they soon use up their budget of £250,000 and encounter problems with their incredibly tight schedule. Kevin McCloud follows their progress.

programme.desc: Medical talk show featuring a panel of practising professionals.

programme.desc: A figure from Howard's past unexpectedly turns up at the police station, and their arrival could lead to a few revelations about the reserved practice manager's background.

programme.desc: Lottery game show, presented by Declan Buckley.

programme.title: RTÉ News: One O'Clock and Weather
programme.desc: National and international news.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Sun-kissed Australian soap charting the latest comings and goings of the Summer Bay regulars.

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Terese takes to the stand and admits that she paid Cecilia to lie, and the judge hands down his verdict as Paul's trial reaches a conclusion.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Donna is mortified by her drunken actions and confides in Pam, who suggests she should put herself forward as the new market inspector. Lauren is stunned to learn that Max has stopped her and Abi from visiting him, while Ronnie tries to warn Roxy away from Andy, but her sister refuses to open up. Pam worries about the Cokers' growing financial problems, and the residents get more than they bargained for at the community centre when the tutor for the salsa class arrives.

programme.title: Neven Maguire: Home Chef
programme.desc: The chef visits the award-winning Kai Cafe and Restaurant in Galway run by David and Jessica Murphy, who show a couple of dishes from their menu using lesser-used cuts of tongue and oxtail. Back home, Neven cooks black pudding hash browns with poached eggs and lemon butter sauce, plus salmon and asparagus wraps with rocket pesto, served with salad and oven-dried tomatoes.

programme.title: Health of the Nation
programme.desc: Dr Mark Hamilton and Dr Nina Byrnes head to Limerick, where they set up a skin-scanning clinic to allow people to check what damage they may have done that puts them at risk of developing skin cancer. Patients include a chronic smoker whose habit is severely affecting his health, and a woman with painful, swollen legs.

programme.title: Home of the Year
programme.desc: Judges Hugh Wallace, Declan O'Donnell and Deirdre Whelan have their work cut out for them as they see two Dublin-based homes and one in Co Wicklow. They look round a petite terraced cottage crammed with creativity, a timber house and a beautifully restored period property. Which one will be chosen for next week's final?.

programme.title: Today
programme.desc: New series. Daily magazine show featuring entertainment and celebrity news, consumer advice, and Ireland's biggest giveaways. Presented by Daithi O Se and Maura Derrane.

programme.title: Nuacht
programme.desc: The latest news headlines.

programme.title: RTÉ News: Six One and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international headlines.

programme.title: Euro 2012 - You'll Never Beat the Irish
programme.desc: Garry Mac Donncha looks back at the tournament in Poland through the eyes of fans who made the journey, football experts and commentators.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Paul encourages Les to take a stand, so he visits Babe and tells her he is prepared to go to the police - even if it means the truth about Christine coming out. Vincent is in two minds about fathering Donna's baby, but agrees to talk to Kim about it - although his attempts are thwarted when a furious Carmel turns up wanting to know why she was banned from the salsa show. Lauren grows frustrated when Ian locks himself away and ignores his grandson, so she confronts him about it, while Ronnie goes on a double date with an anxious Roxy.

programme.title: Fair City
programme.desc: Paul discovers Oisin only gave Jane half of the 10,000 euros he provided to pay her off, and this latest scam proves to be the final straw for Niamh, who calls Nicola and tells her to come to Carrigstown immediately. Meanwhile, Laura and Sash give in to their mutual attraction in the dressing room, and Jackie inadvertently drives Debbie into Tommy's arms by insisting she needs someone to `lean on' during her current ordeal.

programme.title: Follow Donal
programme.desc: Donal Skehan attempts to discover why the residents of Ikaria, Greece outlive the rest of Europe and America by at least 10 years, and finds the answer may lie within their diet.

programme.title: RTÉ News: Nine O'Clock and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news.

programme.title: Prime Time
programme.desc: Current affairs review, covering political and social topics at home and abroad, plus local and international headlines.

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Having identified the body in the cellar as Jimmy Sullivan, Cassie visits the victim's mother, who is relieved that she might finally find out what happened to her son 39 years after he went missing. The detectives focus their investigation on the names in Jimmy's diary, who are revealed to be a government advisor, a priest, a retired bookkeeper and a housewife with a secret past. What part, if any, could these four wildly different people have played in Jimmy's disappearance and demise? Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar star in the crime drama, with Tom Courtenay, Trevor Eve, Bernard Hill and Ruth Sheen.

programme.title: Wellington: The Iron Duke Unmasked
programme.desc: The Duke of Wellington's victory over Napoleon at Waterloo in 1815 made him a towering figure in history, for both his achievements and for embodying the stiff-upper-lip notion of Britishness. This drama documentary focuses on the complexities of the man, drawing on his own correspondence to tell his story through his own words, and using the memoirs and diaries of those who knew him best. Richard E Grant plays Wellington in a series of dramatic reconstructions, creating an intimate portrait of a man who was, in turns, a general, a politician, a lover and an outsider.

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet comes face to face with the man who left her fighting for life just months earlier - serial killer Geoff Hastings, who has vowed to finally reveal the full extent of his crimes. Rachel and the rest of the team investigate the racially motivated murder of a taxi driver. On the personal front, Andy refuses to take no for an answer, so Janet threatens to report him to the DCI. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones, with an appearance by Kevin Doyle (Downton Abbey's Molesley).

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey spreads her wings for the first time since her husband was put behind bars, and invites a handsome footballer round for dinner. Meanwhile, Sharon discovers the joys of literature. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Christmas special from 1989. The Essex girls steel themselves for a lonely Christmas away from their jailbird husbands. Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson star.

programme.title: Telly Bingo
programme.desc: Lottery game show, presented by Declan Buckley.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Colin Mackinnon and his partner Marta Briongos take on an ambitious project to build a bespoke metal home next to an airfield runway, designed by one of Scotland's most eminent architects and inspired by aircraft hangars. They have to contend with violent rain, snow, 100mph winds and the worst storms for a century, and the couple have to draw on their reserves of mental energy, as what was supposed to be a 12-month build heads into a third year.

programme.title: The Doctors
programme.sub-title: Binge Eating at Night/Celebrity Crushes Bad for Your Health?
programme.desc: Medical talk show, in which a panel of practising professionals discusses binge eating and celebrity crushes.

programme.title: Dr Phil
programme.sub-title: We Think Mom Is Cheating, Lying and Choosing Men over Us
programme.desc: Talk show in which Dr Phil McGraw invites guests to confront their problems.

programme.title: Shortland Street
programme.desc: Long-running hospital drama set in a New Zealand accident and emergency ward, following the private and professional lives of the staff who work there.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ayesha wakes up in bed with Sid but as the day progresses she soon begins to tire of his constant attention. Howard feels inspired after a meeting with an old friend, while Heston has the strangest of days after a sleepless night reading.

programme.title: RTÉ News: One O'Clock and Weather
programme.desc: National and international news.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Kat starts digging for dirt on Dylan and pulls Ash into a dangerous scheme to expose him once and for all, while Kyle faces his moment of truth in court.

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Terese's collapse draws Piper and Tyler closer together, and their evening quickly takes a romantic turn, while Ben becomes frustrated when Angus's bad behaviour goes unpunished.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Paul encourages Les to take a stand, so he visits Babe and tells her he is prepared to go to the police - even if it means the truth about Christine coming out. Vincent is in two minds about fathering Donna's baby, but agrees to talk to Kim about it - although his attempts are thwarted when a furious Carmel turns up wanting to know why she was banned from the salsa show. Lauren grows frustrated when Ian locks himself away and ignores his grandson, so she confronts him about it, while Ronnie goes on a double date with an anxious Roxy.

Meanwhile, Laura and Sash give in to their mutual attraction in the dressing room, and Jackie inadvertently drives Debbie into Tommy's arms by insisting she needs someone to `lean on' during her current ordeal.

programme.title: Health of the Nation
programme.desc: Dr Mark Hamilton and Dr Nina Byrnes explore problems associated with bones and joints. A man in his twenties suffering from osteoporosis and a teenager who has juvenile arthritis visit the clinic, while other cases include an annoying fungal infection and a debilitating foot condition. Last in the series.

programme.title: Home of the Year
programme.desc: Judges Hugh Wallace, Declan O'Donnell and Deirdre Whelan gather at Balyna House in Co Kildare where they take a last look back at the properties of the seven finalists who are competing for the title of Home of the Year. Having whittled down the number of competitors from 21, the trio must decide which of the remaining hopefuls' homes is the most impressive before announcing the winner. Last in the series.

programme.title: Today
programme.desc: Daithi O Se and Maura Derrane introduce the best of the Today show featuring their unique mix of consumer tips, fashion, food and health advice, plus memories of some of the most inspirational guests.

programme.title: Nuacht
programme.desc: The latest news headlines.

programme.title: RTÉ News: Six One and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international headlines.

programme.title: Nationwide
programme.desc: News stories from around the country, covering the latest topical issues.

programme.title: How to Cook Well with Rory O'Connell
programme.desc: The chef prepares a three-course meal, consisting of a starter of red onion, roast pepper, rosemary and anchovy pissaladiere, and grilled hake with roast cumin, tomato and coriander for the main course, followed by a desert of praline ice cream.

programme.title: Fair City
programme.desc: Niamh plays nice with Oisin, under the impression that Nicola's imminent arrival will mean he will soon be returning to Cork. However, Nicola and her tearaway son have other plans. Robbie makes contact with a man who claims to have known his mother, and Debbie worries about Emmet after he makes a video in which he threatens pranksters who have been tormenting the family over Katy's disappearance.

programme.title: My Money and Me
programme.desc: A couple expecting their second child had a hard time adapting to a lower income after their first baby, and seek help getting their finances in order before they have another mouth to feed.

programme.title: RTÉ News: Nine O'Clock and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news.

programme.title: Brendan O'Connor's Cutting Edge
programme.desc: TV personality Brendan O'Connor and three regular panellists take a provocative and entertaining look at the week's news from Ireland and around the world, from the big stories, to the nuggets of information that may have escaped the public's attention.

programme.title: The Mario Rosenstock Show
programme.sub-title: The Mario Rosenstock Show - Fun Size
programme.desc: Another chance to catch highlights from the most recent series of the comedian's topical sketch show.

programme.title: Designing Ireland
programme.desc: Award-winning architect Angela Brady and design writer Sandra O'Connell celebrate the best of Irish design. In the first programme, long before words like `design' or ` brand' had even been uttered, when traditional crafts and distinctive buildings told a uniquely Irish story. Along the way they look at some of the country's most accomplished craft-makers, including Joe Hogan's basket designs to Seamus Gill's silverwork, as well as those whose work has found a global audience.

programme.title: Oireachtas Report
programme.desc: Coverage of the day's political proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Maia Dunphy's The Truth About
programme.sub-title: Maia Dunphy's The Truth About Childbirth
programme.desc: Documentary following the TV presenter, who is married to comedian Johnny Vegas, as she prepares to give birth to their first child, revealing the anxieties she faces.(n)

programme.title: Nurses
programme.desc: Documentary about modern nursing from the perspective of six trainees. The students begin their placements and are soon confronted with the harsh realities at hand as Heather experiences a death on her first day, while Eleanor's nerves get the better of her at Lismore House.(n)

programme.title: The Local Eye
programme.desc: Reporters for the Munster Express go in search of Hollywood stars, and the Wild Atlantic Way makes an impact with the Mayo News. Plus, a chance to meet the writers behind the Clare Champion's Dogalogue with Bev and Daisy column.(n)

programme.title: Liveline: Call Back
programme.desc: Joe Duffy looks back at some of the standout stories on the radio talk show, including the Icelandic ash cloud and an 81-year-old man's search for his birth family.(n)

programme.title: Inside Shannon
programme.desc: Niall and the team are under pressure when the airport plays host to its first air show in 25 years. Father-and-son aerobatics team Gerry and Harry take to the skies., while an 11-year-old cancer patient from Galway receives VIP treatment. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Firefighters
programme.desc: The documentary following Dublin Fire Brigade based at stations across the city as they deal with emergencies returns. In the first episode, a batch of 25 new recruits begins the training process to become fully-fledged firefighters, paramedics respond to a collision between a pedestrian and a moving tram, and a major fire at a large warehouse in an industrial estate must be contained before it spreads to other units and destroys the entire complex.(n)

programme.title: Stetsons and Stilettos
programme.desc: Dervla Burke from country and western band Crystal Swing prepares to walk down the aisle in a country music-themed wedding, with a jive dancing priest on hand to perform the ceremony.(n)

programme.title: Exiles
programme.desc: Dylan's girlfriend flies in from New York for the weekend, and Nicola is asked to model for a magazine shoot.(n)

programme.title: Home of the Year
programme.desc: Judges Hugh Wallace, Declan O'Donnell and Helen James examine two properties in Co Sligo - a self-build cob-and-timber frame home, which was completed in 2011, and a renovated cottage with an open-plan design. They end the viewings at a thatched house in Co Galway, which has a homely open stove in the original fireplace.(n)

programme.title: EuroNews
programme.desc: European and international headlines live via satellite.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Shopping from Home

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Tamayo Hussey, who has missed Japan ever since she moved to the UK 14 years earlier with her husband, quantum physics professor Nigel. The couple want to transform a 1960s forester's lodge into a unique Japanese house, complete with a tatami room - decorated in her homeland's traditional style - sliding paper walls and a bath on the roof. Keen to keep costs down, they have decided to engage only the design skills - rather than the full services - of an architect, so with no previous building experience they tackle the project alone.(n)
